about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: You are driving on a city street and see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you. What should you do?

about.name: You are driving on a city street and see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you. What should you do?

hasPart.assesses: You are driving on a city street and see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you. What should you do? | You are driving on a city street and see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you. What should you do? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You must yield the right-of-way to any emergency vehicle that is using its siren and lights. Drive to the right edge of the road and stop until the emergency vehicle has passed. If you are within an intersection, drive through the intersection first and then stop.

suggestedAnswer.text: Drive to the right edge of the road and slow down.

comment.text: Drive to the right edge of the road and slow down.

suggestedAnswer.text: Drive to the right edge of the road and stop.

comment.text: Drive to the right edge of the road and stop.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stay in your lane, slow down, and let it pass.

comment.text: Stay in your lane, slow down, and let it pass.

acceptedAnswer.text: Drive to the right edge of the road and stop.

comment.text: Drive to the right edge of the road and stop.

answerExplanation.text: You must yield the right-of-way to any emergency vehicle that is using its siren and lights. Drive to the right edge of the road and stop until the emergency vehicle has passed. If you are within an intersection, drive through the intersection first and then stop.

comment.text: You are driving on a city street and see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you. What should you do? | You must yield the right-of-way to any emergency vehicle that is using its siren and lights. Drive to the right edge of the road and stop until the emergency vehicle has passed. If you are within an intersection, drive through the intersection first and then stop.

hasPart.name: It is legal to drive with an alcoholic beverage container that has been opened only if the container is:

about.name: It is legal to drive with an alcoholic beverage container that has been opened only if the container is:

hasPart.assesses: It is legal to drive with an alcoholic beverage container that has been opened only if the container is: | It is legal to drive with an alcoholic beverage container that has been opened only if the container is: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Any opened alcoholic beverage container must be kept in the trunk of the vehicle, or in another place where passengers do not sit. Keeping an opened alcoholic drink in the glove compartment is specifically prohibited. However, in a bus, taxi, camper, or motor home, these restrictions do not apply to non-driving passengers.

comment.text: Under the front seat.
In the glove department.
In the trunk.
In the trunk.

answerExplanation.text: Any opened alcoholic beverage container must be kept in the trunk of the vehicle, or in another place where passengers do not sit. Keeping an opened alcoholic drink in the glove compartment is specifically prohibited. However, in a bus, taxi, camper, or motor home, these restrictions do not apply to non-driving passengers.

comment.text: It is legal to drive with an alcoholic beverage container that has been opened only if the container is: | Any opened alcoholic beverage container must be kept in the trunk of the vehicle, or in another place where passengers do not sit. Keeping an opened alcoholic drink in the glove compartment is specifically prohibited. However, in a bus, taxi, camper, or motor home, these restrictions do not apply to non-driving passengers.

hasPart.name: You should not use your horn:

about.name: You should not use your horn:

hasPart.assesses: You should not use your horn: | You should not use your horn: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When driving near a blind pedestrian, using your horn may be dangerous. Yield to the pedestrian and proceed when it is safe to do so.

comment.text: When visibility ahead is limited.

suggestedAnswer.text: If you might hit another vehicle.

comment.text: If you might hit another vehicle.
Near blind pedestrians.
Near blind pedestrians.

answerExplanation.text: When driving near a blind pedestrian, using your horn may be dangerous. Yield to the pedestrian and proceed when it is safe to do so.

comment.text: You should not use your horn: | When driving near a blind pedestrian, using your horn may be dangerous. Yield to the pedestrian and proceed when it is safe to do so.

hasPart.name: When driving in work zones, you should:

about.name: When driving in work zones, you should:

hasPart.assesses: When driving in work zones, you should: | When driving in work zones, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When driving in a work zone, keep a safe distance between your vehicle and traffic barriers, trucks, construction equipment, workers, and other vehicles. Increase your following distance and do not tailgate.

suggestedAnswer.text: Follow the driver in front of you closely.

comment.text: Follow the driver in front of you closely.

suggestedAnswer.text: Pass the driver in front of you as soon as you can.

comment.text: Pass the driver in front of you as soon as you can.

suggestedAnswer.text: Avoid tailgating and keep a safe following distance.

comment.text: Avoid tailgating and keep a safe following distance.

acceptedAnswer.text: Avoid tailgating and keep a safe following distance.

comment.text: Avoid tailgating and keep a safe following distance.

answerExplanation.text: When driving in a work zone, keep a safe distance between your vehicle and traffic barriers, trucks, construction equipment, workers, and other vehicles. Increase your following distance and do not tailgate.

comment.text: When driving in work zones, you should: | When driving in a work zone, keep a safe distance between your vehicle and traffic barriers, trucks, construction equipment, workers, and other vehicles. Increase your following distance and do not tailgate.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: When driving in work zones, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
educationalAlignment.targetName: When driving in work zones, you should:

hasPart.name: Which of these statements is true about roadwork zones?

about.name: Which of these statements is true about roadwork zones?

hasPart.assesses: Which of these statements is true about roadwork zones? | Which of these statements is true about roadwork zones? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Reduce your speed and be prepared to slow down or stop for highway equipment. Driving carefully through work zones improves safety for drivers, pedestrians, bicyclists, and road workers.

suggestedAnswer.text: Fines are the same for violations committed in work zones as they are under normal traffic conditions.

comment.text: Fines are the same for violations committed in work zones as they are under normal traffic conditions.

suggestedAnswer.text: You must "Slow for the Cone Zone."

comment.text: You must "Slow for the Cone Zone."

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down only if you think workers are present.

comment.text: Slow down only if you think workers are present.

acceptedAnswer.text: You must "Slow for the Cone Zone."

comment.text: You must "Slow for the Cone Zone."

answerExplanation.text: Reduce your speed and be prepared to slow down or stop for highway equipment. Driving carefully through work zones improves safety for drivers, pedestrians, bicyclists, and road workers.

comment.text: Which of these statements is true about roadwork zones? | Reduce your speed and be prepared to slow down or stop for highway equipment. Driving carefully through work zones improves safety for drivers, pedestrians, bicyclists, and road workers.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: Which of these statements is true about roadwork zones? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
educationalAlignment.targetName: Which of these statements is true about roadwork zones?

hasPart.name: When passing on the left of a vehicle, it is safe to move back into the right lane:

about.name: When passing on the left of a vehicle, it is safe to move back into the right lane:

hasPart.assesses: When passing on the left of a vehicle, it is safe to move back into the right lane: | When passing on the left of a vehicle, it is safe to move back into the right lane: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When passing another vehicle on its left, you may move back into the right lane when the headlights of the passed vehicle can be seen in your rearview mirror. Always signal before changing lanes.

comment.text: After about three seconds.

suggestedAnswer.text: When you can no longer see the vehicle over your right shoulder.

comment.text: When you can no longer see the vehicle over your right shoulder.

suggestedAnswer.text: When you can see the front of the vehicle in your rearview mirror.

comment.text: When you can see the front of the vehicle in your rearview mirror.

acceptedAnswer.text: When you can see the front of the vehicle in your rearview mirror.

comment.text: When you can see the front of the vehicle in your rearview mirror.

answerExplanation.text: When passing another vehicle on its left, you may move back into the right lane when the headlights of the passed vehicle can be seen in your rearview mirror. Always signal before changing lanes.

comment.text: When passing on the left of a vehicle, it is safe to move back into the right lane: | When passing another vehicle on its left, you may move back into the right lane when the headlights of the passed vehicle can be seen in your rearview mirror. Always signal before changing lanes.
